body_html:
Hello, @IFLED, thanks. The layer definition and python function definition are as following. When my code was executed, it didn't go into myPyFunc at all. Did I miss anything?

def myLayer(self, input, name):
        with tf.variable_scope(name) as scope:
             d_num = input.get_shape()[-1]
             d = tf.reshape(input[0][:,:,1], [1,-1])
             e = tf.py_func(myPyFunc, [d], [tf.float32])
             e = tf.convert_to_tensor(e)
             return e

def myPyFunc(input):
        print "===Hahaha==="
        return 0

body:
Hello, @IFLED, thanks.  The layer definition and python function definition are as following. When my code was executed, it didn't go into myPyFunc at all. Did I miss anything?

```
def myLayer(self, input, name):
        with tf.variable_scope(name) as scope:
             d_num = input.get_shape()[-1]
             d = tf.reshape(input[0][:,:,1], [1,-1])
             e = tf.py_func(myPyFunc, [d], [tf.float32])
             e = tf.convert_to_tensor(e)
             return e

def myPyFunc(input):
        print "===Hahaha==="
        return 0
```
